T11.7 Update state and decision log

D-031_config_data_model.decision: Pydantic models for all config types (typed configs)
D-031_config_data_model.reason: Fail-fast validation critical for unattended agents; pydantic already in deps

D-032_config_validation_timing.reason: Don't debug config during LLM call; catch errors at startup

D-033_config_merge_strategy.decision: Simple override chain — args > provider > global, flat merge, last-writer-wins
D-033_config_merge_strategy.reason: TOML structure is flat-ish; deep merge is overkill

D-034_config_file_discovery.reason: Config ships with the library; __file__ works in dev and installed modes

D-035_provider_name_validation.decision: Strict regex validation on provider_name before path construction
D-035_provider_name_validation.reason: Path traversal prevention — NIST 800-53 AC-3, OWASP A01 compliance for federal production

D-038_stop_reason_normalization.decision: Canonical StopReason Literal type — adapters map provider-native values to end_turn/tool_use/max_tokens/stop_sequence
D-038_stop_reason_normalization.reason: Unified interface requires provider-agnostic stop checks; Literal catches typos at validation time

D-039_tool_result_flattening.decision: OpenAI adapter flattens one ArcLLM message with N ToolResultBlocks into N separate OpenAI messages
D-039_tool_result_flattening.reason: Agents use same ToolResultBlock pattern regardless of provider; adapter owns translation complexity
alternatives_considered: require agents to use different message format per provider

D-040_mirror_adapter_structure.decision: OpenAI adapter mirrors Anthropic adapter's private-method-per-concern pattern
D-040_mirror_adapter_structure.reason: Proven in Step 3; consistency across adapters for maintainability and learnability
alternatives_considered: different structure optimized for OpenAI's simpler API

D-041_convention_based_registry.decision: Provider name drives TOML path, module path, and class name by convention
D-041_convention_based_registry.reason: File structure is the registry. Zero config for discovery. No mapping dict to maintain.

D-042_class_name_convention.reason: Predictable, no exception maps. Pure convention means zero maintenance.

D-043_module_level_config_cache.decision: Cache ProviderConfig in module-level dict with clear_cache() for testing
D-043_module_level_config_cache.reason: Avoids re-parsing TOML per load_model() call. Essential at scale with thousands of agents.

D-044_no_kwargs_load_model.decision: Remove **kwargs from load_model() — only provider and model params
D-044_no_kwargs_load_model.reason: BaseAdapter.__init__ doesn't accept **kwargs; forwarding them causes confusing TypeError at adapter construction time instead of clear API error
alternatives_considered: catch TypeError and wrap in ArcLLMConfigError

D-045_no_hyphens_provider_names.decision: Provider name regex allows underscores but not hyphens: ^[a-z][a-z0-9_]*$
D-045_no_hyphens_provider_names.reason: Provider name maps to Python module name via convention; hyphens are invalid in Python identifiers. Allowing them would pass validation but fail at import.
alternatives_considered: keep hyphens and auto-convert to underscores at import time

D-046_lazy_adapter_imports.decision: Adapter classes lazy-loaded via __getattr__ in __init__.py, not eagerly imported
D-046_lazy_adapter_imports.reason: import arcllm should not trigger httpx loading; adapters loaded on-demand by load_model() or explicit attribute access

D-047_wrapper_module_pattern.decision: Wrapper classes (middleware pattern) — each module is an LLMProvider wrapping an inner provider
D-047_wrapper_module_pattern.reason: Composable, testable independently, transparent to agents. Scales to N modules without adapter changes.

D-048_separate_retry_fallback.decision: Two separate modules: RetryModule and FallbackModule (not combined)
D-048_separate_retry_fallback.reason: Single responsibility, independently configurable, can use one without the other

D-049_retry_triggers.reason: Industry standard retryable codes; 529 is Anthropic-specific overload

D-050_exponential_backoff_jitter.decision: Exponential backoff with jitter: min(base * 2^attempt + uniform(0, base), max_wait)
D-050_exponential_backoff_jitter.reason: Prevents thundering herd; jitter decorrelates concurrent retriers

D-051_config_driven_fallback_chain.decision: Config-driven fallback chain with on-demand load_model() for each fallback provider
D-051_config_driven_fallback_chain.reason: Only creates fallback adapters when needed; chain order from config.toml
alternatives_considered: pre-loaded fallback adapters at construction time

D-052_proportional_jitter.decision: Jitter proportional to backoff: uniform(0, backoff) not uniform(0, base)
D-052_proportional_jitter.reason: Review fix — fixed jitter scales with exponential backoff to better prevent thundering herd at higher retry attempts
alternatives_considered: full jitter: uniform(0, backoff) replacing backoff entirely

D-053_module_config_validation.decision: Bounds validation in RetryModule and FallbackModule constructors
D-053_module_config_validation.reason: Review fix — 3 agents flagged missing input validation. Invalid configs should fail at construction, not during operation.

D-054_module_settings_cache.decision: Pre-extract module settings dict from pydantic model_dump() into _module_settings_cache
D-054_module_settings_cache.reason: Review fix — avoids repeated model_dump() calls (2x per load_model() call). Cache populated on first global config load.

D-055_rate_limit_algorithm.decision: Token bucket algorithm — capacity=burst size, refill_rate=RPM/60 tokens/sec
D-055_rate_limit_algorithm.reason: Allows bursts (good for agents waking simultaneously), enforces average rate, battle-tested (nginx, AWS API Gateway)

D-056_rate_limit_scope.decision: Per-provider shared buckets — all agents using same API key share one bucket
D-056_rate_limit_scope.reason: Matches how provider rate limits actually work. Per-instance would multiply the effective rate.

D-057_shared_state_pattern.decision: Module-level registry dict in rate_limit.py — consistent with config cache pattern in registry.py
D-057_shared_state_pattern.reason: Simple, testable via clear_buckets(), same pattern used for config caching

D-058_throttle_behavior.decision: Block (async wait) + WARNING log when throttled
D-058_throttle_behavior.reason: Transparent to agents, ops gets visibility into throttling via logs

D-059_burst_config.decision: Separate burst_capacity param, defaults to requests_per_minute, overridable via load_model()
D-059_burst_config.reason: Global default in config.toml, overridable per-call. burst_capacity defaults to RPM for sane defaults.

D-060_stack_order.reason: Rate limit wraps adapter directly — each actual API call is throttled. Retry/fallback wrap outside.

D-061_provider_id.decision: Read inner.name for bucket lookup key
D-061_provider_id.reason: Consistent with LLMProvider.name property, already available, no extra config needed

D-062_validation.decision: RPM > 0, burst_capacity >= 1 — raise ArcLLMConfigError on invalid values
D-062_validation.reason: Fail fast at construction, consistent with RetryModule/FallbackModule validation pattern

D-063_test_cleanup.reason: Test isolation requires clearing shared state between tests. Automatic via clear_cache().

D-064_telemetry_output.decision: Structured logging only — no callback, no accumulator
D-064_telemetry_output.reason: Simple, toggle-able via config, no functions in load_model() config. Budget and OTel handle their own concerns.

D-065_telemetry_cost.decision: Calculate and log cost_usd per call from provider pricing metadata
D-065_telemetry_cost.reason: Pricing already in provider TOML; cost per call is essential for budget tracking and ops visibility

D-066_pricing_injection.decision: load_model() injects pricing from ProviderConfig model metadata into telemetry config dict via setdefault()
D-066_pricing_injection.reason: Pricing lives in provider TOML, TelemetryModule shouldn't know about ProviderConfig. setdefault() allows explicit overrides.

D-067_telemetry_stack_order.reason: Measures total wall-clock including retries, fallback, and rate-limit wait. Most useful operational metric.

D-068_telemetry_log_level.decision: INFO by default, configurable via log_level in config dict
D-068_telemetry_log_level.reason: Telemetry should be visible when enabled. Configurable for noisy environments.

D-069_telemetry_log_fields.decision: provider, model, duration_ms, input_tokens, output_tokens, total_tokens, cache_read/write_tokens (conditional), cost_usd, stop_reason
D-069_telemetry_log_fields.reason: Complete operational visibility per call. Cache tokens omitted when absent to reduce noise.

D-070_audit_output.decision: Structured logging using shared log_structured() helper from _logging.py
D-070_audit_output.reason: Consistent with telemetry. Shared helper handles sanitization, None omission, float formatting. One place to change format.

D-071_audit_log_level.decision: INFO by default, configurable via log_level. Same validation pattern as TelemetryModule.
D-071_audit_log_level.reason: Audit events should be visible by default for compliance.

D-072_audit_fields.decision: provider, model, message_count, stop_reason, tools_provided (conditional), tool_calls (conditional), content_length
D-072_audit_fields.reason: Covers compliance-relevant metadata (NIST 800-53 AU-3) without PII exposure.

D-073_pii_safe_audit.decision: No raw message content or response content logged by default
D-073_pii_safe_audit.reason: Federal compliance: audit trail must not create new PII exposure vectors.

D-074_content_opt_in.decision: include_messages and include_response boolean flags, content logged at DEBUG level
D-074_content_opt_in.reason: Double opt-in: config flag + DEBUG enabled. Production typically has DEBUG disabled.
alternatives_considered: log at same level as audit record
